item.title: Open settings
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The settings page can be opened either via the main menu or the toolbar.
item.content:encoded: The settings page can be opened either via the main menu or the toolbar.

item.title: Toolbar
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: From a certain screen width (approx. 600px), the toolbar is displayed in the header of the app next to the info elements, with which you have direct access to some of the functions that can also be accessed via the menu. (Icons are hidden depending on whether you are logged in or whether certain functions ... Toolbar
item.content:encoded:
From a certain screen width (approx. 600px), the toolbar is displayed in the header of the app next to the info elements, with which you have direct access to some of the functions that can also be accessed via the menu. (Icons are hidden depending on whether you are logged in or whether certain functions of the phone are permitted, for example).

01 – Select or add service provider and account. A pop-up list is displayed containing the registered service providers and accounts with them. The icon consists of two parts, the person and the globe. Both can be colored separately. The colors mean
white – service is connected online, or user is logged in
amber – service is not online, data from the cache is displayed
red – The connection to the service could not be established or the login failed

02 – Show list of current and future bookings
(Only visible when logged in)

03 – You can use the filter to restrict the display to items with certain properties.
(Only visible if the service offers filters)

04 – Reloads the data from the service provider or from the cache

05 – Centers the map so that all stations are visible

06 – Displays the current location on the map
(Only visible if the device has positioning and this has been permitted for the app)

07 – Opens the settings page

item.title: Main menu
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: You open the main menu via the button at the top left (three horizontal bars). Menu items are hidden depending on whether you are logged in or whether certain functions of the phone are permitted, for example. 01 – Current service provider (if more than one provider is registered, the list can be expanded and ... Main menu
item.content:encoded:
You open the main menu via the button at the top left (three horizontal bars).

Menu items are hidden depending on whether you are logged in or whether certain functions of the phone are permitted, for example.

01 – Current service provider (if more than one provider is registered, the list can be expanded and a provider selected). The color symbolizes:
green – connected to the service online
amber – no connection to the service but data from cache
red – service connection failed and no cache data

02 – Serviceaccount, wobei die Farbe bedeutet:
green – user logged in
amber – user logged in but not connected (cache)
red – user login failed (no cache)

03 – Add new service provider

04 – Register account for the selected service provider

05 – Show list of current and future bookings
(Only visible when logged in)

06 – You can use the filter to restrict the display to items with certain properties.
(Only visible if the service offers filters)

07 – Reloads the data from the service provider or from the cache

08 – Drop-down menu for map properties

09 – Centers the map so that all stations are visible

10 – Displays the current location on the map
(Only visible if the device has positioning and this has been enabled for the app)

11 – Show or hide buttons for zooming the map (+/-)

12 – If a position is displayed (location (10) or address (14)), a circle is displayed as the distance radius around this point

13 – An address whose position is displayed on the map can be entered here.

14 – Opens the settings page

item.title: Display informations
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: There are two main views, the map view and the list view. The app usually starts with the map view, but remembers the last view and starts with it the next time it is called up. You can switch between the views using the circular button at the bottom right (06). Map view If the ... Display informations
item.content:encoded:
There are two main views, the map view and the list view. The app usually starts with the map view, but remembers the last view and starts with it the next time it is called up.

You can switch between the views using the circular button at the bottom right (06).

Map view

If the app is connected to a service, the available stations of the provider are displayed on the map with a bicycle sign symbol.

If you tap on one of the symbols on the map, you will receive an overview of this station and its items.

The elements of the pop-up are clickable and display different information in each case:

The pop-up shows the availability of the item for the next six days.


The stations are displayed as symbols (01). The active station is displayed as a red bicycle symbol (02).

The elements of the station pop-up can be clicked and have the following function:


03 – the details of the item are displayed
04 – the details of the station are displayed
05 – the booking calendar for this item is displayed.
06 – Switch to the list view

If a station has more than one item (as in this example), this is indicated by a dotted line at the bottom. The content of the popup can then be scrolled to the other items.

Listenansicht

The pop-up shows the availability of the item for the next six days.

03 – the details of the item are displayed
04 – the details of the station are displayed
05 – the booking calendar for this item is displayed.
06 – Switch to the list view

If a station has more than one item (as in this example), this is indicated by a dotted line at the bottom. The content of the popup can then be scrolled to the other items.

Display of item information

The information provided by the service provider for this item is displayed in the pop-up.

Display of station information

The information provided by the service provider for this station is displayed in the pop-up.

item.title: General
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Various app settings can be changed on this settings page. 01 – What should be executed when the app is started.1 02 – Set the language of the app 03 – Show/hide zoom buttons on map 04 – Slider to set the size of the station markers on the map 05 – Reset station marker ... General
item.content:encoded:
Various app settings can be changed on this settings page.

01 – What should be executed when the app is started.1

02 – Set the language of the app

03 – Show/hide zoom buttons on map

04 – Slider to set the size of the station markers on the map

05 – Reset station marker size to default

06 – Enter network timeout via numeric keypad2

07 – Set network timeout to unlimited2

08 – Set network timeout with slider2

09 – Test url to determine whether the Internet is accessible

10 – Save the changes made

1 The following selection options are available:
Last service/user (online) => The app attempts to re-establish the last online connection
Last service/user (offline) => The app does not go over the network but loads the last known data from the cache
None => The app starts without an initial action

2 Basically, the app tries to wait for a network request until a response or a timeout is canceled by the device. It is possible that this can lead to extremely long waiting times on some devices before the app realizes that it is not receiving a response. In this case, you can use this setting to specify a maximum waiting period in seconds for the app.

item.title: Register user (account)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: If you also want to book items with a service provider and manage the bookings, you must have an account with the service provider (follow the provider’s registration process). In addition, the provider must support the app, i.e. the CommonsAPI must be accessible and Extension API must be installed and activated. There are three ways ... Register user (account)
item.content:encoded:
If you also want to book items with a service provider and manage the bookings, you must have an account with the service provider (follow the provider’s registration process).

In addition, the provider must support the app, i.e. the CommonsAPI must be accessible and Extension API must be installed and activated.

There are three ways to call up the dialog to register a user:

Option1: After the new registration of a service provider

If you have registered a new service provider and tap on “Save” (5) in the dialog, the dialog for registering a user is then opened automatically.


Note:
It is not absolutely necessary to register a user. If you do not wish to do so, you can simply cancel the register user dialog.

Option2: Register user Dialog via main menu

If you have selected a service provider in the main menu, you can use the menu item “New account” to register a user for this provider in the app.

Option2: Register user Dialog via Settings

Click the “New” button under “Account(s)” to open the dialog box for entering the user’s data

Register user (account)

To register, you need the login name and login password from the service provider. These correspond to your login details on the website.
(Note: in exceptional cases it is also possible that you receive the application password separately from the service provider, in which case you do not need the login password)

Enter the data in the dialog, where Display name is optional.

01 – Name that is displayed in the app for this user

02 – Login name at the service provider

03 – Login password for the service provider

04 – If you have received an application password, tap here and enter it.

05 – If you want to cancel the process, tap here

06 – Saving account registration

item.title: Register new Serviceprovider
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Ein Serviceanbieter ist eine Verleihorganisation, die Gemeingutartikel über eine Webplattform anbietet. Eine solche Webplattform ist über eine eindeutige Url (Link) erreichbar. Um mit der App auf die Angebote zugreifen zu können muss die Plattform die folgenden Voraussetzungen erfüllen: Es gib zwei Möglichkeiten einen Serviceprovider für die App zu registrieren, über das Menü oder über den ... Register new Serviceprovider
item.content:encoded:
Ein Serviceanbieter ist eine Verleihorganisation, die Gemeingutartikel über eine Webplattform anbietet. Eine solche Webplattform ist über eine eindeutige Url (Link) erreichbar. Um mit der App auf die Angebote zugreifen zu können muss die Plattform die folgenden Voraussetzungen erfüllen:

  • Die Plattform wird mit dem CommonsBooking Plugin betrieben
  • Für die Anzeige der Angebote:
    die CommonsAPI (Bestandteil von CommonsBooking) ist aktiviert und frei zugänglich
  • Für Buchen und Verwalten von Buchungen:
    Eine Anmeldung an der Website und Installation des Plugins „API for CB App“.

Es gib zwei Möglichkeiten einen Serviceprovider für die App zu registrieren, über das Menü oder über den Einstellungen Dialog.

A service provider is a rental organization that offers public domain items via a web platform. Such a web platform can be accessed via a unique url (link). In order to be able to access the offers with the app, the platform must fulfill the following requirements:

  • The platform is operated with the CommonsBooking plugin
  • To display the offers:
    the CommonsAPI (part of CommonsBooking) is activated and freely accessible
  • For booking and managing bookings:
    A login to the website and installation of the “API for CB App” plugin.


There are two ways to register a service provider for the app, via the menu or via the settings dialog.

Option1: Service provider dialog via menu

Select the “New service” menu item to open the dialog box for entering the service provider’s data.

Option2: Service provider dialog via settings

Click the “New” button under “Edit service” to open the dialog box for entering the service provider’s data.

Entering the service provider’s data

01 – Link to the provider’s website

02 – Test connection

03 – Name displayed in the app for this provider

04 – Cancel without saving the entries

05 – Save the service data and continue to register account

Test connection

You can have the app test whether the url to the service provider can be reached and which access options (interfaces) it supports.


To do this, enter the url in “Register service” or via the “Edit service” settings and tap on “Test connection” (02).


Examples of the test results

Example1: All functions are supported by the service provider

 

Netzwerkverbindung testen
Netzwerk verfügbar

 

 

Website Verbindungstest
Link Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

REST API Verbindungstest
Rest API Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

CommonsBooking API Test
CommonsBooking API vorhanden

 

 

Login Test
App Login aktiviert

 

 

App Extension API Test
App Extension API vorhanden!

 

Test network connection
Determines whether this device has a network connection


Website connection test
Determines whether the url is accessible via the network


REST API connection test
Determines whether the service provider has activated the WordPress REST API


CommonsBooking API test
Determines whether the service provider has activated the CommonsAPI


Login Test
Determines whether the service provider allows login via an application password


App Extension API Test
Determines whether the extension for the CB App is installed and activated


RESULT:
The service provider’s information can be displayed in the app and bookings can be made if an account is available.

Example2: Website accessible, CommonsBooking (API) available but no Extension API

 

Netzwerkverbindung testen
Netzwerk verfügbar

 

 

Website Verbindungstest
Link Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

REST API Verbindungstest
Rest API Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

CommonsBooking API Test
CommonsBooking API vorhanden

 

 

Login Test
App Login aktiviert

 

 

App Extension API Test
Fehler!

 

In this example, the website of the url is accessible and also has the WordPress REST API and CommonsBooking including API activated. However, the extension API is not available.


This is the case, for example, with a WordPress site with CommonsBooking but without app support.


RESULT:
The service provider’s information can be displayed in the app, but booking is not possible.

Example 3: Website accessible, but without CommonsBooking (API) and Extension API

 

Netzwerkverbindung testen
Netzwerk verfügbar

 

 

Website Verbindungstest
Link Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

REST API Verbindungstest
Rest API Adresse erreichbar!

 

 

CommonsBooking API Test
Fehler!

 

 

Login Test
App Login aktiviert

 

 

App Extension API Test
Fehler!

 

In this example, the website of the url is accessible and also has the WordPress REST API activated, but CommonsBooking is not installed or the API is deactivated.


This is the case, for example, with a WordPress site without CommonsBooking (or API not activated).


RESULT:
The app cannot display information for this site, nor is booking possible.

Example4: Error in Url

 

Netzwerkverbindung testen
Netzwerk verfügbar

 

 

Website Verbindungstest
Bad Request

 

 

REST API Verbindungstest
FormatException: Unexpected character)

 

 

CommonsBooking API Test
Fehler!

 

 

Login Test
Fehler!

 

 

App Extension API Test
Fehler!

 

No connection can be established to the specified url.


This is the case, for example, if the url is incorrect or does not exist.


RESULT:
The app cannot display information for this site and booking is not possible.

item.title: Item booking
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: You can only book an item if you are logged in. To do this, search for the desired item on the map or the list: Open the station display by tapping on the icon of the station (01 here 02). Call up the booking calendar by tapping on the overview calendar (05). Bookable days are ... Item booking
item.content:encoded:
You can only book an item if you are logged in. To do this, search for the desired item on the map or the list:

Open the station display by tapping on the icon of the station (01 here 02).


Call up the booking calendar by tapping on the overview calendar (05).

Bookable days are indicated by a green circle.

If you tap on a free day (01), a green frame indicates the maximum number of days you can book the item.
To make the booking, tap on a second day within the permitted range (02) (if you only want to book one day, tap again on the day already selected).

The Booking button is now green. If you want to add a comment for the station, open the comments field with the + (04).

Complete the booking with the button (03).

(Note: if you want to cancel a selection, tap the Reset icon (05) or by double-tapping on a free area in the booking calendar).

item.title: Offline (Cache)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The app can also be used to a limited extent without an internet connection. For this purpose, part of the data is saved locally for each online connection to a service provider.(This behavior can be deactivated for each service provider in the settings (e.g. to save local storage space)) Bookings cannot be made in offline ... Offline (Cache)
item.content:encoded:
The app can also be used to a limited extent without an internet connection. For this purpose, part of the data is saved locally for each online connection to a service provider.
(This behavior can be deactivated for each service provider in the settings (e.g. to save local storage space))


Bookings cannot be made in offline mode. Accordingly, the availability calendar is displayed in read-only mode.


The booking list is also available in read-only mode, i.e. the information can be viewed but a booking cannot be canceled (the time at which the data was last updated is displayed in the top line).


You can tell whether the app is in offline mode by the fact that the icon next to the main menu button has changed. The date and time when the data was last loaded online is also displayed there.

01 – Icon symbolizes the offline mode by color and type

02 – The badge shows the date and time when the data was last loaded online

item.title: Edit service
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: On this settings page, you can edit, create or delete existing service providers and account registrations. 01 – Select existing from the list 02 – Edit service url 03 – Connection test 04 – Edit display name 05 – Activate/deactivate offline storage for this service 06 – Delete last offline storage for this service 07 ... Edit service
item.content:encoded:
On this settings page, you can edit, create or delete existing service providers and account registrations.

01 – Select existing from the list

02 – Edit service url

03 – Connection test

04 – Edit display name

05 – Activate/deactivate offline storage for this service

06 – Delete last offline storage for this service

07 – Save changes to the service registration

08 – Delete this service registration (also deletes all account registrations for this service)

09 – Create new service registration (dialog)

10 – Select existing account from list

11 – Change the login name of the account

12 – Change the display name of the account

13 – Remove account registration

14 – New account registration (dialog)

15 – Save changes to account registration
